Review.Titre: Very slow internet, waste money
Review.Contenu: I had really slow internet connectivity, even in major cities like Bangkok. It took 6-10 seconds to load every single webpage or google maps location, which is extremely frustrating when you're a traveler trying to navigate in a new place. The FAQs and instructions were not helpful either. Meanwhile my friend who bought a local SIM card had fast internet. I should have done that too.

Review.Titre: It was literally a waste of my money
Review.Contenu: The app and the E-sim were a complete disaster, travelling around Europe, it eventually worked, less than 20% of the time, but the rest of the time I had forced to pay roaming from my local mobile phone company (ATT USA), Their customer service is just a Q&A and they definitely haven't something to change, the system doesn't work. It worked in London for 1 day of 3, It didn't work in Amsterdam, Cambridge, Belgium. It worked fine in Paris, but it didn't work at all in Berlin, Vienne and Budapest. Almost a month, is it worked 6 days? maybe it too much to say.

Review.Contenu: The purchase process went more or less smoothly. Got Australia 20Gb eSIM which was Truphone and was using a Vodafone network. Compared to other eSIM I was purchasing in other countries, this one often gave me "Emergency calls only" and "No service" errors when trying to use this card for data. Amaysim on Optus provided me with better connection and reliability.

Review.Titre: I used Nomad in April in Berlin and it…
Review.Contenu: I used Nomad in April in Berlin and it worked flawlessly. This week I am in Bergen Norway and it is impossible to connect via Nomad. The only way I can get online is using mr Verizon travel plan which is costing me $10/day on top of the wasted $33 I spent on Nomad. Very disappointing. I had recommended Nomad to several other people who travel internationally but will no longer do so.

Review.Titre: Browsing web was fine but each time I…
Review.Contenu: Browsing web was fine but each time I tried to download an app it wasn't possible, it said it would take 17h for a 50Mb app.

Review.Titre: Charged twice for 1 plan, Nomad refuse to help
Review.Contenu: I ordered a 45 day, 20GB APAC e-sim for $26. Nomad charged me twice on paypal and when i notified them of this they claimed they could not help me, despite me providing screenshots of the transactionas from my paypal account.I have now raised a dispute with paypal which Nomad have ignored, so awaiting a refund once paypal rule in my favour. Very poor service indeed, it seems they are incapable or unwilling to fix their mistake.*Edit*Just to clarify they only rectified their mistake after I disputed it on paypal. Their reply to this suggests they sorted this issue out themselves - they did not. They were completely unable to help me for 4 days, then magically after a paypal dispute they were able to help me - funny that.

Review.Contenu: Unclear directions on website and via staff. American format instructions that do not match UK phones. QR code reading that did not work. Difficult manual loading with very long codes. Even when we did get the system working (on a multi country trip) we could not use it. Total waste of money.

Review.Contenu: Really unreliable service in EU. Frustrating to have to work with customer service on troubleshooting every few days. I would have preferred being given a new eSIM or something else instead of texting, calling, and trying to fix something that shouldn't have been giving problems. My requests for a new eSIM were largely ignored .I went with a different provider. It's been much better since making the move.

Review.Titre: Support is so bad
Review.Contenu: Support can not answer in 24 hrs, total waste. I need to use my card cuz plan is not activated, but I can not reach the support, poor service :(

Review.Titre: From Great to Zero on Same Trip
Review.Contenu: I tried Nomad for the first time on my current trip to Asia - Singapore, Taipei, and Hong Kong. My experience in Singapore was worthy of 5 stars. Nomad worked like a charm as soon as I left Changi Airport and that flawless service endured for the entire week in Singapore. However, Taipei service was spotty to non-existent and I was forced to turn on my Verizon cellular service. I noticed that Verizon and Nomad used the same local carrier, so I have no clue why Nomad’s eSIM didn’t work. I followed the recommendations to turn Airplane mode on and off, reboot my phone, etc., and finally gave up and just stayed with my Verizon plan. I landed in Hong Kong yesterday and the same thing happened. I got service for about five minutes, then completely failed, so it looks like my experiment with Nomad is a one-and-done.

Review.Titre: I hired a service on my Trip to Sri…
Review.Contenu: I hired a service on my Trip to Sri Lanka and I pay without having any internet connection for three weeks. I ended buying a SIM card locally because it was impossible to connect. You should update your services because it is not nice that you offer it and it does not work....

Review.Titre: Getting initially connected to a…
Review.Contenu: Getting initially connected to a network took days.  Nomad customer service was only available via email; no live chat possible. So I was left sending/receiving multiple emails attaching multiple screenshots.  Due to multiple time zone difference between me and Nomad customer service, I couldn’t always get usable information promptly.  CS suggested multiple local networks that never appeared as options on my phone.  I chose to pursue my vacation rather than wait for customer service response after every CS suggestion. Nomad needs 24/7 live chat support.  Join the 21st Century.

Review.Titre: Coverage was very bad with multiple disruptions
Review.Contenu: Coverage was very bad. I used this service in Japan in multiple cities. Even in Tokyo, I kept get getting disruptions. Randomly it we would lose signal and we had to wait for it to start up again. Another friend used the same service and noted the same problems. In the bullet train it was painstakingly slow to load a simple website.One of my friends had a normal Japanese SIM and another had a US sim and they had no disruptions and perfect coverage everywhere we went. I recommend buying an eSIM from a service provider in the country you are visiting.

Review.Titre: There might be better companies
Review.Contenu: One of the more affordable eSIMs in Sri Lanka. Unfortunately, we had a lot of trouble with it. Oftentimes, the data was very slow or did not work at all. It just was not very reliable and I had trouble hotspotting my partner.

Review.Titre: Very disappointing
Review.Contenu: Very disappointing Esim installed per directions, but could not get useful data connection.Ended up turning your off and using the Verizon travel plan which will cost me substantially more.Had seen you in NY Times and was expecting a much better experience.

Review.Titre: Internet speed very slow
It logs you out so often and guess what…
Review.Contenu: It logs you out so often and guess what you need internet to login.  Basically you need internet from somewhere else multiple times a day to use internet. In most part of London it is extremely slow

Review.Titre: Worst internet ever
Review.Contenu: Worst internet ever - I have been travelling through fairly popular tourist areas (Rome, Naples, Berlin) and the internet speed has been at best very slow and at worst non-existent, dropping out entirely for no reason at all or appearing to give one or zero bars when my native sim (inactive for data roaming) is giving full reception. Have wasted so much time trying to use very basic functions on the internet with this terrible reception. Would not recommend. Even if you get a relatively large data pack (20GB in my case) there is just no way you could ever use it up with these slow speeds and bad reception.

Review.Titre: Hard to activate, or just doesnt work.
Review.Contenu: I bought the e-sim and followed the instructions.  It did not work.  Their process is not simple with the QR code to activate, unfortunately.  I think that is how it got sideways, but perhaps it just does not work well.  I am not a novice to e-sim, I have done it before and use a dual sim for travel several times a year.  I was just up for trying a different e-sim company unique to the country I was visiting.  I really wanted this to work, but unfortunately I put money down the drain.

Review.Titre: Do not trust their “unlimited” offers
Review.Contenu: I’ve used their normal eSIM offerings successfully in the past but would *never* trust one of their “unlimited” eSIM deals again after today. The eSIM kept disconnecting, and when it was connected it never got 5G connection speed even when it was available. Basically “unlimited” appears to be severely limited at their end by having such a rubbish flaky connection that you’ll be forced to use another internet connection (as indeed I’m using to write this review).  Will never trust again :(

Review.Titre: Phone always shows you’re in Hong Kong
Review.Contenu: This was my first experience with an eSIM and unfortunately it was not great. In New York City it worked quite well, seemingly without issue, but as soon as we left NYC our phones kept telling us we were in Hong Kong. We couldn’t use TikTok, prices would show up in Hong Kong Yuen, several sites wouldn’t provide us access saying they were not providing access to Hong Kong. While the data was working relatively consistently in major cities, as soon as we exited a major metropolitan area the speed and quality of the connection dropped drastically, sometimes not working at all. For about 80% of the trip our iMessage was not working. Unsure why but it seemed to be related to the Hong Kong aspect mentioned above. We were also unable to message each other with iMessage the entire time after we left NYC (21 days) and had to use other solutions. Lastly, and this is simply a reminder to myself and word of caution to other travelers, we opted to only get a data plan without a phone number to save money and that was a mistake. We NEEDED to call places several times and simply couldn’t, which caused delays and complications on our trip. So, unfortunately I cannot recommend this service.

It’s an e-sim, how hard can it be to transfer? They literally have that option listed in the app but it’s total bs!

Review.Titre: It isn't working and I keep getting…
Review.Contenu: It isn't working and I keep getting roaming charges from my provider back home.Nomad messaged me below and told me to contact them for more investigation.  I emailed them with more detail and they replied 5 days later offering me $3 off my next purchase.  Hopefully that isn't all of the compensation they will offer.  As the roaming fees I was hit with were a lot more than $3.  This is on top of the $65 I paid intially.Update, the below response from nomad had some false information.1.  They never mentioned anything about a refund in an email to me.  (They have given me a refund now).  Hard for me to respond for a refund when they didn't offer.2. Nomad had asked me to email the support with my order number to investigate, that is what I did, so that is sending a ticket in my opinion.  If there was some other way for me to submit a ticket, nomad never provided that information to me in the reply.It seems nomad is trying to make it look like I didn't contact them correctly, and that I didn't respond to a question when in fact, I did what they asked in emailing about the issue, and they never asked me about getting a refund when they sent me the $3 off next purchase email.Pretty poor customer service in my opinion.

Review.Titre: Fantastic when it works; support horrible when it doesn't
Review.Contenu: I used Nomad for a recent trip to the UK (London) and El Salvador. In the UK, everything worked great – I had no problems with my UK plan and a solid connection everywhere you would expect to.Things were very different in El Salvador. The plan details for this eSIM clearly said I could expect "4G/LTE" speeds. However, once I activated the plan, the plan details in the Nomad app said "Speed: 3G". Sure enough, I could only get a 3G network connection, which was next to unusable. I also had my existing Verizon plan active on the phone, and had LTE coverage on that SIM almost everywhere in El Salvador, on the exact same network (Movistar) as the Nomad eSIM. It is clear that I was sold a 3G only plan by Nomad, since their eSIM would not connect at anything over 3G while I had full bars of LTE on another SIM on the same phone at the same time in the same location. I can see from other reviews here that I am not the first person to experience this exact issue using a Nomad eSIM in El Salvador.But the real problem here? Nomad's support. I outlined all this to Nomad via the app multiple times, and the support team was like a broken record. There were constant requests to update my data settings, screenshot my data settings, reboot my phone (even when I had already just done all of this multiple times), and an insistence that I was receiving 3G speeds because of the geographical location I was in and that it must be because the location only had 3G coverage (clearly not the case, given I had 4G on my Verizon SIM on the same phone). Every time I contacted support to let them know I still wasn't connected to 4G, they would message me something like "we see that your usage has gone up 50MB so it looks like your data is working", to which I repeatedly had to explain that I had never said I didn't have working 3G data, just that I could not connect to the 4G network as promised.I lost count of the times I had to repeat myself, change my settings, restart my phone – eventually I gave up, because 3 days into my 5-day trip I had spent more than enough time and energy trying to get my Nomad eSIM working as advertised. Horrendously frustrating experience, and at literally no point during my many, many messages with support did I feel like they could understand the problem or help me with it. They seemed completely incapable of going off-script, and frustratingly their script had very little to do with the problem I was experiencing.I ended up buying another travel eSIM from Maya, which worked perfectly, was significantly cheaper, and gave me the 4G speeds I was expecting (on the same phone and same network as the Nomad eSIM, nonetheless).Ultimately, I paid for a 4G plan and not once was connected to 4G, and there was nothing resembling an offer of a refund (even a pro-rated one, given that I did use SOME data on 3G).5 stars for the flawless service in London.1 star for the service in El Salvador.1 star for the support.

Review.Titre: Easy to set up much like most of the…
Review.Contenu: Easy to set up, much like most of the esims i tried; unfortunately, this is one that i felt was not worth the money.  After 2 days of use, my data is gone— all it kept saying was i do not have internet connection and it turns out it has downgraded me to 3G.  I never thought i would consume 10GB in 2 days since from what i know, i just used it mostly to navigate.  but even then, it said that it would continue to have internet connection but at a slower speed, only to find out it would keep sending me no internet connection when i needed to connect on the 3rd day. I needed to get another esim since i really needed wifi for my travel.

Review.Titre: Tiktok unavailable with this sim
Review.Contenu: Something to note for nomad esim is that it doesn't allow tiktok. I have to turn off the Sim for tiktok to work on WiFi. For whatever reason if the nomad esim is active, it will not allow tiktok to connect to network. The Sim works otherwise but if you are needing social media access to tiktok, than avoid this.

Review.Titre: Turkcell - Local Esim from Nomad - Manipulation in Data Record
Review.Contenu: My wife signed up with Nomad for their 3 GB with Turkcell to be used in Turkey as a local sim, The entire data plan got used up within 2-3 days, even though we were using it sparsely. Then we bought another package for 5GB esim, which again got used up within 2 days. I feel there is some sort of dishonesty in the data plans, my wife is a light-medium user and we were on holiday with Wi-Fi available at our hotel throughout. In total, we have spent around $18 in total for 3gb+5gb = 8GB data. The network has been excellent but there are some discrepancies with the data not honestly being shown.

Review.Titre: I did not work when rained etc
Review.Contenu: Going to Italy, I decided to use Nomad eSim. It started okay at the beginning, but, after, it went terribly. The problem was, that every time it rained, I lost my connection. And one day, out of nowhere, my connection was lost again for hours. The point I am making is that Nomad is ideal for infrequent use in a vacation, but you cannot count on Nomad.

Verbatim example: "I can now see a huge increase in data usage from 2.976GB to 3.020GB / 15GB. It seems that the connection is better." A huge increase. Of 0.04G.News alert - just because it sort of works sometimes doesn't mean it's working as expected, or satisfactorily. Next time I'll use another company.

Review.Titre: Very slow access even with perfect coverage
Review.Contenu: Not the best SIM card, but it worked, at least in London. It uses a budget version of Vodafone UK for carriage, but A friend got a local Vodafone UK SIM card, I got the Nomad version. Same phone, same reception, he had fast internet, I had unusably slow to moderately fast internet. With perfect 5 bars, I was getting just under 5Mbps, but was often slower than that. It was routing all my traffic to Sweden which causes... interesting effects for Google recommendations and search results (finding results in Sweden rather than the UK). Other than that, the process was fairly smooth - just remember you need internet access to activate it which isn't provided through the SIM, so you won't have access until you find free Wi-Fi unless you activate it before you leave.

Review.Titre: Intermittent connection to the network
Review.Contenu: I installed my esim (Truphone) on 6 April in Sydney Australia. It worked perfectly for 3 days, until I landed in Melbourne Australia. The esim then started disconnecting from the network every few minutes, or even seconds, and worked only intermittently. I tried the trouble-shooting tips, i.e., turning on airplane mode for 30 seconds, switching esim on-and-off, rebooting my phone, but without success. I contacted the helpdesk and they gave me more tips. I made screenshots of all my settings and sent to the helpdesk. They confirmed that all setting was correct. However, the problem continued until I purchased, out of frustration, a physical sim card and disabled my Nomad esim. Thanks and have a lovely day

Review.Titre: Nomad eSIM worked well, but local SIM card was much cheaper
Review.Contenu: The Nomad eSIM data plan worked well in Egypt. Nomad delivered as expected. However, the Nomad data plan was very expensive compared to local rates. When I arrived at the airport in Egypt, I got a local SIM card with 12 GB data for the same price as 1 GB data from Nomad. With the local SIM card I also got a local number and 450 minutes of local calls which came in handy when calling guides that had local numbers. I can only recommend Nomad eSIM if you are unable to get a local SIM card when arriving at an airport in Egypt.

Review.Titre: Value for money.
Review.Contenu: Value for money.Good reception in Bali.Quick to receive the link and setup. The app is good to monitor data usage.It took a while to actually get it working once we arrived. We could not connect to the internet. After lots of trial and error we managed it. Something to do with the roaming settings. Suggest clearer instructions to get working once activated. Hence I dropped the stars.Overall though we were very satisfied and will use again.

Review.Titre: Deceptive advertising
Review.Contenu: I liked the reliable 4G connection, that worked great in the remote areas of Norway.  I also appreciated the relative ease of activating my esim I didn't like that there was no customer support offline.  My sim card stopped working when I travelled into Sweden.  Your app is very deceiving in that it says it works throughout the EU, it wasn't clear that you had to buy a new plan with each country so I was only able to use 1/2 of the data and time I paid for .. not impressed with that

Review.Titre: Could be better for returning users
Review.Contenu: It was my second time using Nomad, wasn't sure I could reuse the same e-sim and didn't find the info anywhere. When I did mange to make it work by reinstalling a new one, the e-sim monitoring page was saying the card was not activated while I still had internet, meaning I couldn't monitor my data consumption. So yes it worked but was a bit of a frustrating experience.

Review.Titre: Fairly straightforward to use
Review.Contenu: This was fairly economical to use while in Europe, amd allowed pretty smooth connectivity during the trip. TInitially there were some glitches with it, and I had to use my data plan coverage,  which was costly,  and couldn't use phone or access messages, but managed with Whatsapp and Messanger. Great short term.

Review.Titre: Automatic start to “Add On”
Review.Contenu: I moved to France for a short work contract and I’m using NOMAD rather than getting a proper sim. The first one was fine and decided to do an “arson” before it expired. The problem is, the add on didn’t automatically start despite claiming it would, leaving me with no signal or connection. I had to go to local “Brasserie” at 11:30pm to order a drink to use their wifi to check emails, messages, etc and buy another esim to ensure I got through the days ahead.

Review.Titre: Awesome once it's set up correctly
Review.Contenu: Once activated, this service worked super smoothly. However, I had issues getting Nomad to work initially. For the service to work, "Data Roaming" needed to be active on my iPhone, which I wasn't aware of. That information was only available via their online help page (which required internet, so I needed to find a free Wifi hotspot).

Review.Titre: didn't work everywhere it was supposed…
Review.Contenu: didn't work everywhere it was supposed to work. I had to go back to my carrier and buy an expensive amount of data so I could do some connections with hotels and other places. Update: In the last few weeks I have seen Nomad do serious analyzes of the situation to understand what went wrong and following that, made changes to make sure this kind of situation doesn't happen again. What I saw was a company that listens to the costumer and takes action when it's needed. The next time I have a similar need I will have no hesitation in trusting Nomad again. It's a company that just want the best for their customers.

Review.Titre: It worked, but connection is routed via Hong Kong!
Review.Contenu: It worked really easy and I didn't have any problems with connections. But I booked an eSIM for the US and yet my IP address was always in Hong Kong. As a result, I was often shown websites and search suggestions in Chinese and my logins locked up due to suspicious login locations. It is unacceptable that it does not state anywhere beforehand that the connection is routed via Hong Kong!

Review.Titre: Not the best in Germany
Review.Contenu: It is easy to create an account and buy a data plan.However, when it comes to the data service, it's not the best. In Germany, O2 was selected as the preferred network. The webpages couldn't be loaded and the service was downgraded to 2G!!!Manual switching to Vodafone helped. However, the next day my phone was on O2 network again.Not the best experience.

Review.Titre: I bought 2 Europe e-sim card
Review.Contenu: I bought 2 Europe e-sim card, installed on my wife’s and my iPhones and activated prior to our trip. My wife’s e-sim card worked very well throughout our time in Europe. I never got mine to work. In fairness to Nomad, their tech support was very responsive, more responsive than me, after several unsuccessful days I gave up and worked around it

Review.Titre: Constant E-sim restarts
Review.Contenu: Pricing was good, and it was relatively easy to set up. For some reason, every time I dropped out of reception though, the E-sim would go wonky. I would have to turn the Sim off and on again, and sometimes restart my 4g connection in order to bring it back online. This happened numerous times and got really frustrating

Review.Titre: I was able to download the eSim but...
Review.Contenu: I was able to download the eSim but had difficulty in activating it on my Android phone. They asked for fingerprint and did not give me the option of using a pattern.I will still use it again. Price is reasonable

Review.Titre: Reception was only good for the first few days
Review.Contenu: The reception of the internet was good for the first 2-3 days but the internet connection became so unstable after that. I noticed the telco was changed to another one but I couldn't load google at all. Sometimes it even showed no service.

Review.Titre: It took few hours to get it working…
Review.Contenu: It took few hours to get it working abroad and I needed to call the car agency. This is after I already installed the app and put the eSIM number as secondary. Tried activating through the app, scanning the QR code and what not. at home. I don’t remember what finally worked, maybe reboot. Once working it is working fine with good reception and 0 issues

Review.Titre: The app is loading really slow
Review.Contenu: The app is loading really slow, even on the Wi-Fi network. I’m stuck looking at the splash screen animation which stops and then it is static. Then you should include some more animation just to cut boredom waiting to see app and just to check how many Gb is left in my package. I’m using the IPhone 13pro max so it’s not a slow phone. And the 4G internet you have provided me with is of rather questionable quality, but I thing this is not what you asked to review.

Review.Titre: The plan worked pretty well
Review.Contenu: The plan worked pretty well. I could have used a few more instructions on connecting to the new countries' network, it was hard to find. Also my main reason for only 3 stars is that I got no warning for when I was getting close to using my data and I got stuck in a big city in a country I didn't speak the language of with no way to contact my friends. If I had been warned I would've added more data when I was still able.

Review.Titre: Esim Usa with T-mobile speed poor 4G
Review.Contenu: Essy to install on my Iphone 13. Instruction easy. Start my travel New Hampshire, Vermont, Maine. Coverage weak signal check a lot. Data transfert very slowIy. I disappointed. Question If take esim with order provider AT&T coverage it is best in the area?

Review.Titre: Not completely reliable
Review.Contenu: I bought a Europe eSIM and for the most part it worked ok. My two complaints, though, is that even though it said LTE+, it wasn't as fast as my LTE+ with my physical SIM card in Canada. My 2nd complaint and this is more serious than the speed, is that while I was in Vienna, Austria, my connection kept dropping! I don't believe I had the same issue in Bratislava, Slovenia, Budapest and Zagreb or at least it wasn't as noticeable or as frequent as in Vienna.

Review.Titre: Great to use data, painful to install
Review.Contenu: Overall I liked using Nomad and worked quite well for the period I purchased. However, the installation process is painful and the instructions were not clear. Perhaps the company should re-write the install instructions or even make a video with the steps.

Review.Titre: Service was acceptable
Review.Contenu: Service was pretty good. Had some issues with geofences for IP addressed (registering for local parking options), had to use a VPN to access a server in the USA to register. Setting up the e-sim wouldn't work unless on a wifi, using the QR code without internet, or copying and pasting the codes wouldn't work... Also, lost all of my contacts on iPhone until I got back to my original SIM card at home.

Review.Titre: Uneven Connections
Review.Contenu: Even though a lot of our journey along the corridor from Billings to Lake Tahoe involves a lot of rural areas, we were still getting only 1-2 bars of connectivity even in several larger centres. Downloading information was very slow because of it. There was no connection to Verizon at all as we were driving up to Billings on our return trip home though we did have connection to a network the following morning when we left Billings.

Review.Titre: The 2nd time (Singapore) I had trouble…
Review.Contenu: The 2nd time (Singapore) I had trouble to activate the eSim. Before in Thailand it worked well. I followed all your instructions but failed. After some time I gave up. Most probably it was my fault but generally I am smart enough to manage this kind of „technical challenges“. I think you could be more successful if the process of activation would be more simple. For the time being I will use other eSim providers but I will as well follow your App to see if you can make some effective improvements - in general I like your App. So - maybe I will be back one day. Best regards Dirk Polte

Review.Titre: The connection issues
Review.Contenu: The connection is fluent, when there is internet. however many times in public places or on specific times on the day, there is no connection

Review.Titre: Set up was easy, but it stopped working
Review.Contenu: Set up was easy.  It worked right away upon landing.  Everything seemed perfect until it stopped working.Settings weren't changed - I simply no londer had a connection.  I needed to find a place with free WiFi to reach customer service.Nomad customer service was really good and had me change settings and restart the phone.  It did the trick.The SIM stopped working a couple times more, but a restart got it going again.Unfortunately, I can't leave a high rating given that the SIM left me cut off away from our resort.

Review.Titre: Slower data speeds on T-Mobile US
Review.Contenu: Gotta say that the data is significantly slower on the T-Mobile network. I switched from SimTex to Nomad and saw a decline in service. In addition, certain US sites are blocked since the IP address is originating from a foreign country.

Review.Titre: Works on smartphone, impossible to use hotspot. Frequent disruptions in data
Review.Contenu: Works well for basic stuff on your smartphone, but it is literally impossible to use it as a hotspot, I had chosen Nomad as it’s one of the few e-sims that allow hotspot in Spain. There are continuous disruptions and you need to switch on/off airplane mode to get the line. Will probably consider again for buying a few GB for my smartphone, but please don’t rely on Nomad to use your device as a hotspot (host server is in Sweden so ping is always extremely high)

Review.Titre: Poor coverage
Review.Contenu: Following my review below Nomad contacted me, offered to investigate, subsequently confirmed my experience, issued me a refund and assured me that they now have offerings that would address the poor coverage. Hence, I cannot fault the support they have offered. I will find out about the coverage when I next travel.I really like the ability to buy mobile coverage for trips in a convenient way. But for my recent US west coast trip the coverage provided was poor overall even in the SF Bay Area.

Review.Titre: App is good, plans are hit or miss
Review.Contenu: The NOMAD app is pretty easy to navigate and the plan costs are reasonable. However, the plan I got was provided by T-Mobile and the coverage was very poor. On a trip from NYC to Niagara up state, the service dropped frequently. My cousin had Verizon on her phone and her service was very consistent (thankfully since we needed Google Maps for the journey).

Review.Titre: Good package but sudden connection stopps
Review.Contenu: If the coneection worked it was really good. But on some days I had no connection for hours and also on my 10th snd last day in Malaysia the internet didn‘t work what really annoyed.I don‘t know why it stopped working but it couldn‘t the end of my data package bc I had 15 GB and had only the 10th day. When it worked I had good connection and it was easy to install and also the price was good compared to others.

Review.Titre: Installation is easy, pricing is good, reception mediocre
Review.Contenu: This is a good deal for traveling. However, in the US the reception isn’t too good. It’s very unstable, mostly AT&t (almost never Verizon).

Review.Titre: Not what was promised
Review.Contenu: I did not find this exerience as promised. My card failed to start on arrival, saying 'expired' before my holiday started. This took some time to be resolved. I had chosen to top up after the first month as I was not sure how much data I would use, however even though all instructions were followed to the letter, my top up did not kick in as expected. This meant that I lost the remaining data credit from the first card, then spent a day with no phone waiting for support. I am not likely to use again. Disappointing.

Review.Titre: We had some problems to connect by the…
Review.Contenu: We had some problems to connect by the time we arrived in Austria.However, our son was able to assist as he was in Brazil and he entered in the platform to solver the problem.We also did not know that there would be a limit to use the system and I got really frustrated by the time that I could not mantain the operation.In this scenario, I do suggest to receive a message by the time that  the credit is finishing and offering the opportunity to renew it.

Review.Titre: Easy to purchase
Review.Contenu: Easy to purchase, hard to cancel.The installation instructions are incomplete.I had to restart one device and take out the physical sim of another.Everything worked well after the initial issues were resolved.

Review.Titre: Hard to get started, slow in USA
Review.Contenu: I can say it works eventually, but it took one day before it started. If there was no Wi-Fi on the airport or I wasn't picked up by a friend i would be in bad position.I'm still giving 3/5 as the support is very responsive and definitely want to help, but the service in USA it's quite poor.

Review.Titre: Poor to non internet connection
Review.Contenu: The internet connection throughout our holiday in Greece was average to poor. Me and my brother both of us purchased a 30 day 20 GB Europe data package.We travelled from Alexandrapol to Halkidiki and Kavala. Overall we couldn't use the data plan almost at all. We ended up using 5 GB data each. Unfortunately I wouldn't advice this data plan to anyone who is going to travel the same path.Update:On 30th of July I sent an email to the mentioned address and shared our Order IDs. Since then I am waiting. I will keep the message updated if any change happens.Update 2:On 7th of August I received an email from Nomad Support Team that they refunded the unused amount of the price back to my credit card. Moreover they also provided a 3$ promo to my account.All in all even though we had a bad experience during our holiday, the support team and after sales handled the issue exceptionally. Thanks for the support and understanding.Thanks,

Review.Titre: Easy to use but poor coverage
Review.Contenu: I went for a T-Mobile SIM - while the price was good there was hardly ever any network coverage, whether in big or small cities. In the end I never had to worry about using up my data, because I could hardly ever connect.The product was easy to use and compare, but the network quality was a crucial miss

Review.Titre: Useful but slow at times
Review.Contenu: I've used Nomad on 4 trips to the states in the past 6 months for the sake of convenience and cost effectiveness. It is a cheap option compared to buying sim-card and it's easy to install as it doesn't require a physical sim. However during certain times on our trips, we would run into slow speeds from the connectivity to a point where nothing loads on our phones. This has caused frustration as we rely on apps such as Google Maps for navigation and other apps for Parking. One thing to point is that this doesn't happen all the time but at random times during the day and it would be consistent with all of the other phones that are using Nomad within our group. I really hope Nomad will work on maintaining the stability of their network speeds as this app is too useful to be malfunctioning.

Review.Titre: Overall experience was good
Review.Contenu: Overall experience was good. It would be very helpful to send a notifications when the limit of data are coming to limit. Also after the eSim limit was used the app showed notification that I don't have internet connection instead of showing that all data limit was used. That was confusing and misleading.Otherwise the net worked pretty well, instructions how to set it up were clear to follow.

Review.Titre: It’s an overpriced way of solving the…
Review.Contenu: It’s an overpriced way of solving the sim issues with travel . I like the choice of large or small plans , but doing your homework realises the expensive option that often can’t be justified

Review.Titre: Hard to get access to everything on my phone
Review.Contenu: I was not user friendly to use after the installation. We are 6 With  this application and we had a lot of problems to get all the services that se want.

Review.Titre: eSim tech kinda cool, net cost savings nil
Review.Contenu: The eSim itself worked well enough, but there was no net benefit because it didn’t save enough usage on my international roaming, and 1GB of data isn’t what it used to be.  My $9 experiment with an eSim taught me I don’t have much use for an eSim.

Review.Titre: SIM card problems in 2 Countries
Review.Contenu: Initially the sim card did not work in two countries I visited (France and Italy).  Customer support was helpful in providing the needed APN and network information (and directions on how update it) to make the sim card work.  Customer service was helpful in getting the sim card working again, but I would recommend requesting APN and network settings from Nomad prior to travel if you do not have a back-up option.Update:  Nomad did provide a link to changing the APN in one of the set-up e-mails.  Be sure to ask for the country specific networks in advance and know you may need to reset up the APN as you travel between countries.

Review.Titre: Easy to use but very slow connection
Review.Contenu: First time user, refer from a friend who used Nomad for Spain trip.  I used for my 14 day USA tripPro: easy setup and use, price is reasonable.Con: very slow connection, there is no way this is 5g or even 4g.  Feels like 3g.  I did follow the instructions and triwd to switch between networks but doesn't make any difference.  The slow connection is not just 1 spot,it was the whole trip in big cities like Washington DC or New York city.

Review.Titre: Pros and cons
Review.Contenu: I liked the ease of buying an eSim prior to my travel. It felt new and practical. My son had to install it for me. Once in NY it took me a while to understand I needed to press data roaming to get the internet (it was in the instructions). WhatsApp functioned well, but Google Maps and the GPS did not. I did not get internet on the street. I wish it had come with a telephone number. I am glad I tried it, but next time, unless you develop this more, I will probably get a physical sim card

Review.Titre: Was OK, but will compare with other providers next time.
Review.Contenu: Relatively easy to install and to use. Prices are just OK and below the exorbitant prices from main carriers when roaming. Network was quite slow and weak in Playa del Carmen, Mexico. Barely not 4G.

Review.Titre: Data stops working at 0.6GB
Review.Contenu: The data stops working when you have a balance of 0.6GB. Initially, I thought it was some trouble with the network, but later, when I add-on my package, it instantly continued working like a charm. Then it happened again when my data reached 0.6GB. It was a day left on holiday, and 0.6GB would have been enough, but I had to add-on again just to get it working. Disappointed.

Review.Titre: I am afraid that I found No ad very…
Review.Contenu: I am afraid that I found No ad very difficult to set up. I am not a complete Luddite when it comes to technology but found it hard to get the settings right on my phone. I was the first five days of my trip without access and finally cracked the correct combination of this turned off and this turned on. I reached out to the help desk at day five and they did try to contact me to assist but when travelling these things can be tricky. Now that it is running, it is good. I would use it again but the instructions are not that clear for older people who may not be as tech savvy as more experienced or younger people.

Review.Titre: Promotion code did not work
NOMAD is great but speed is terrible
Review.Contenu: The purchase and activation process is easy, the SIM card activated as soon as I connected to the network and you can track data use in the app which is great.The issue is the data speed and stability of this service. I bought a 10GB Asia SIM to use in Singapore and India, it's with JoyTelecom. The connection was so bad in some cases I had to connect to a local's hotspot which was fast and stable. Video calls connect ok, but freeze every few seconds. Downloads are slow and in some cases they just stop as if they don't work. Even with this SIM card I was constantly looking for wifi. I would happily pay more for a faster more stable connection, but this is the only option. It's disappointing given everything else about my experience with NOMAD is positive.

Review.Titre: Great when it worked
Review.Contenu: Great when it worked - but kept saying I wasnt connected even though I had a strong 4G connection.

Review.Titre: E sim and a primary carrier don’t play well together if you have a major carrier
Review.Contenu: I could never figure out how to not get travel pass charges from my US carrier - Verizon.  They just said to put the phone on airplane mode.  That totally defeats the purpose of using Nomad.  I just gave up and used their service, so wasted my nomad money.  Nomad help desk didn’t really help either.  Nomad is prob fine if you don’t have another carrier like Verizon.  Would love to know how to get it to work as we have other trips,  it am doubtful

Review.Titre: Not good not bad
Review.Contenu: I bought it for Germany, France, Luxembourg and Belgium. I have started to my trip from Berlin / Germany. And I almost could not connect to the internet in Berlin for 4 days. And this was also same for Nuremberg and Dresden. After 7 days I can use only 200mb internet. It was terrible. But outside Germany it was good.

Review.Titre: Interface is nice and everything but…
Review.Contenu: Interface is nice and everything but all I wanted is a data plan and somehow it didn’t work as expected.1. Since the customer are using it mostly on vacations, time is critical here and customer service that answer after a few hours or the next day is problematic. 2. Unlimited plans and very much limited to a 2 gigs a day, so basically if you’re on a 7 days vacation and you bought an unlimited plan you maybe got a 10 gig plan, and probably less than that.3. In my case, after using my 2 gig on 1 day, cx said I should be able to have my full bandwidth after 24h max which didn’t happen and basically never restored to the speed I first had. 4. Cx said you’ll refund me with half the  money, but it didn’t happen. Overall 3/5 because it worked fine for a few days.

Review.Titre: many steps to switch over to the secondary or the nomad e-sim from the primary SIM card from my regular home service
Review.Contenu: After clicking to install the E-SIM in the email sent after purchase, and finally arriving at my vacation Destination, I discovered there are many steps to switch over to the secondary or the nomad e-sim from the primary SIM card from my regular home serviceThen I was asked perplexing questions about icloud account settings and other little pop ups that were confusing and not clearly explainedDefinitely not a one click changeover to nomad!

Review.Titre: Many times the service is interrupted…
Review.Contenu: Many times the service is interrupted and there is no internetكثير من الوقت تنقطع الخدمة ولا يوجد انترنت

Review.Titre: Data Connection
Review.Contenu: It does work very well. It was quite difficult to connect for use. There are several times data connection got lost. Voice conversation has very low quality.

Review.Titre: Not good for hotspot usage
Review.Contenu: Works great for one device but only messaging worked when I connected my other device via hotspot even though I should have had 4G

Review.Titre: Good and easy to use when you install
Review.Contenu: At first, it was easy for me to install the esim. When i tried to recharge it, I was unable to make it work. So I had to use my own plan which led me to pay 15$ plus taxes for one day. Instructions are not enough clear and example screen doesn't show tha same thing on my iphone. I will need to contact client support to make it work

Review.Titre: The first time I used Nomad worked so…
Review.Contenu: The first time I used Nomad worked so well , next time not so much . It wouldn’t work for me half the time so ended up just deleting before it expired so as I would have internet even though costing me more .

Review.Titre: Product is solid but integration tricky.
Review.Contenu: Product is solid, but integration with iphone is tricky. Installation instructions did not match what I experienced, so it required some research and experimentation to sort out. The app has disrupted imessages and integration of that function across my devices. WIll things return to normal once my plan is expired and I remove the esim? We'll see. As with many apps, nomad takes a breezy approach to communications that doesn't match the complications customers encounter. It's annoying and unnecessary.

Review.Titre: I wasn't aware that SIM app-activation is required
Review.Contenu: I wasn't aware that activating the eSIM in the Nomad App was a prerequisite for use. I assumed it would function once the eSIM was turned on in the destination country, similar to how Airalo operates. However, after activation, it worked flawlessly.

Review.Titre: The signal was poorly (interrupted…
Review.Contenu: The signal was poorly (interrupted sometimes), mostly in small town. Maybe they miss the inclusion of 5G signal in your package for Greece. Furthermore, the application in general was good.

Review.Titre: Great, just need more data!
Review.Contenu: I travel a lot and find the nomad sim great for when I first land in a new country and need mobile data for a day or two before I get a local sim. I appreciate the mobile app and how quick it is to spin up a new sim.My only gripe is the data packages are way too small on the lower plans. More than one I've used all the data wayyy before the sim expires.

Review.Titre: USA and Mexico
Review.Contenu: I used for my travelling in USA and Mexico. The US was ok but there was always problem to find reception in Mexico.

Review.Titre: It took me hole day to activate  ESIM…
Review.Contenu: It took me hole day to activate  ESIM on my phone. Eventually I was advise manually  change my phone network setting, rename APN. Also communication speed wasn't great.

Review.Titre: The internet is too slow
Decent app, lame spam emails
Review.Contenu: The app works as expected and provided excellent coverage during a recent trip.The fact their marketing emails have no automated unsubscribe link, and that you have to fill out a form on their website to opt-out of spam is comple

Review.Titre: App doesn't sync with purchase
Review.Contenu: I purchased my data package online and downloaded the app afterwards to keep better track of my usage on my device, but the app didn't sync properly with the actual activation date.  The app only started counting the days when I activated the app, not the data package, so it's not useful at this point.

Review.Titre: I had difficulty setting it up and…
Review.Contenu: I had difficulty setting it up and didn’t think the help information offered enough detail. I finally got it working by trial and error.

Review.Titre: Setting up the e-SIM was unsuccessful…
Review.Contenu: Setting up the e-SIM was unsuccessful couple of times and then it suddenly work. Although the SIM was installed as requested but the app didn't find it.

Review.Titre: It was good and fast but for some…
Review.Contenu: It was good and fast but for some reason I was unable to scroll tik tok till I turn off this e sim in msia

Review.Titre: The eSim works slowly
Review.Contenu: The eSim works, but not at the speed of a physical local sim. Somehow the 4G connection is a lot slower and many areas with poor signal, more like a 3G

Review.Titre: Good price but slow speed & coverage
Review.Contenu: Pound for pound Nomad has best price for data. Mine was using T-Mobile network. Connection speed was only 4G (not LTE or 5G). Sometimes, signal is good but could not load a page in a browser, and had to use WiFi. Sometimes, I just don't get any data connection.

Review.Titre: Prompt when data is about to end would be nice
Review.Contenu: Data does not kick in immediately,The app should give you a notification when your data is ending, and prompt you to purchase add ons

Review.Titre: I found it difficult to activate
Review.Contenu: I found it difficult to activate, and it did not help me much in China, but that could be because I was unsure how to configure it

Review.Titre: Internet kept dropping out and taking a…
Review.Contenu: Internet kept dropping out and taking a while to connect when leaving somewhere with Wifi. But when the internet worked there was no issues.

Review.Titre: After 100 mb, it's throttled in NZ
Review.Contenu: After 100 mb, the usage on the network in NZ was throttled to the point where I can't get data.I'm supposed to get 10gb of data for 30 days. Nomad is a rip off. Avoid at all costs.Edit: they reenabled data almost immediately but I gave 3stars because the speed is slow.

Review.Titre: Dependable connection - slow speeds
Review.Contenu: Dependable connection. But slow (under 10 mbps) in comparison to someone used to higher connection speeds. Priced properly,

Review.Titre: Some places there are no signal and…
Review.Contenu: Some places there are no signal and some places the data discount but overall it’s a good app and easy steps to install

Review.Titre: Slow wireless speed
Review.Contenu: Everything was fine expect the internet speed. I use airalo usually which provides might faster wireless connectivity.

Review.Titre: Internet wasn't very fast
Review.Contenu: Internet wasn't very fast, although it's 5G, it was slower than 4G at my network operator back home.

Review.Titre: Experience using Nomad eSIM
Review.Contenu: Works great when in the lager cities. Very spotty and unreliable when travelling between states and smaller towns.

Review.Titre: easy to use, bad in crowds
Review.Contenu: The Nomad eSim is easy to use; however in crowded areas the service becomes null as if there is no eSim at all.

Review.Titre: not so good in Johor
Review.Contenu: Worked well previously in Europe but not so well in Bali and latest try in Johor.You need to get more coverage in Johor, Malaysia.

Review.Titre: Easy solution with limitations
Review.Contenu: Easy to set up but since it used 4G and 3G network, coverage was difficult at some places.

Review.Titre: Was not able to activate my plan at…
Review.Contenu: Was not able to activate my plan at website(the button was missed, some problems with layout apparently), only in app

Review.Titre: eSIM install needs to be easier
Review.Contenu: The idea and presentation of the app are good. On Android Nomad does not work as well as Airalo. With Nomad you have to take screenshots of QR codes to install instead of a single click.

Review.Titre: The signal is not that good
Review.Contenu: The signal is not that good, sometimes I have no service where my friends do have.The purchase through the app was really easy and it was also easy to install on my Samsung.

Review.Titre: Slow spee, UK prices shown here n Google
Review.Contenu: I was travelling in the US. Speeds were slow even when showing 5G. Any google searches showed pricing in UK pounds not US$. Google news was all UK based.

Review.Titre: More expensive than other companies but the speed and connectivity were great
Review.Contenu: The internet speed and connectivity were both great, never had any problems with the speed or the connectivity. The only downside is that it’s pricy. It’s more expensive than all the other companies out there, there were most definitely cheaper options. That’s why I’m giving 4 Stars. The price can be matched with other companies, other than everything else was great about this eSIM internet.

Review.Titre: Most the Time Good only had 2 Days the…
Review.Contenu: Most the Time Good only had 2 Days the connection could not be established but the Price is right half what my Provider asks for.

Review.Titre: Easy, convenient but pricy
Review.Contenu: I used nomad a lot as I was travelling, and choosing a package for a continent rather than each individual country was an excellent feature! However, I did find the prices pretty expensive.

Review.Titre: Pretty reliable service & mostly seamless.
Review.Contenu: Pretty reliable service.  Several hours offline when arriving in Cambodia. Wasn’t clear how to get support to fix the issue. Otherwise seamless and good experience.

Review.Titre: Average Coverage in Paris
Review.Contenu: the coverage around Paris was not great at some places but overall it was okay.

Review.Titre: Works well but complicated to activeate
Review.Contenu: The eSIM worked well but was not as straightforward to install nd activate as described

Review.Titre: Worth it. Recommend it
Review.Contenu: Advantage: really easy to set up. Immediately connect once landed airport. No hassle to look for telco ship.No issue using in cairns cbd area-for payment, book Uber etc.Disadvantage: few locations had no data or totally unable to downloading such as Daintree  forest, cairns railway station, inside kuranda railway and on Great Barrier Reef cruise

Review.Titre: So far so good
Review.Contenu: So far so good. I've used it in Hongkong, Vietnam, Singapore, Indonesia, Australia. I've only lost signal in Cambodia but no big deal. 😀 i hope Nomad will have 5G soon as well.

Review.Titre: First time using eSim
Review.Contenu: First time using eSim. Lot easier than I thought. Only glitch was when I added more time, I had to actually enter it, when the website told me it would do that automatically.

Review.Titre: Problem with network selection
Review.Contenu: I was at the bus and I needed my phone to show the bus ticket in the app and suddenly I noticed that internet was off. I explained the situation to the bus driver and he let me enter the bus. At home, reading Nomad FAQ I learned that network selection is automatic by default and if internet doesn't work you can change and select another network. Now everything is ok!

Review.Titre: To be honest l try many esim in Turkey…
Review.Contenu: To be honest l try many esim in Turkey but  my son ask me to use your esim and am happy with it 😊. I will ask people going to use Nomad. Is the best 👌

Review.Titre: Well priced product that we used in China
Review.Contenu: We used Nomad and it gave a really well priced and reliable service that we used in China. I have given a 4 star review as the set up was a little confusing as a UK user since the instructions were based on settings on US (I assume) mobile phones, and individual screenshots of the steps to take would have been useful rather than  quickly repeating video shots. It also took a couple of days for the esim to activate on one of our phones which we weren’t expecting and didn’t know how to speed up the connection process. Overall however, I would recommend and use when travelling again.

Review.Titre: eSIM works
Review.Contenu: The one thing I don't really understand is why QR codes are the way phones have chosen to go for these sims.  The only way I could figure out how to activate was to ask a stranger to take a picture of the QR code on my phone, such that I was able to use my QR scan on the picture... There's got to be a better way.

Review.Titre: Was nice that I was able to immediately…
Review.Contenu: Was nice that I was able to immediately use it and  the UX was not bad. The main problem is that the connection is not really good and sometimes I had to wait a bit until was able to find a network. But great value for the money 💰

Review.Titre: Works in Quintana Roo
Review.Contenu: Works in Quintana Roo. Select the Truphone option to have access to Telcel as they have the better connectivity. You have enable roaming for it to work. The install was pretty straightforward. Mostly need this for Google Maps for navigation and you get 4G in most major roadway areas. Might have trouble in the jungle, but didn't go that far off the beaten track.

Review.Titre: Great to have cheap international data
Review.Contenu: The data was great, and so much cheaper than roaming. It was a bit fiddle to set up, but it was worth it. The texts worked in the country, but I couldn’t get them working with international numbers. But overall, really happy.

Review.Titre: Easy to connect
Review.Contenu: Easy to connect, but I don't know why the speed is quite slow in Germany, especially when it has reached the limit of my package. I bought for 10 GB but the speed became slower when it reached 8 GB.

Review.Titre: Once set up great service and value
Review.Contenu: I did have some trouble getting the settings right for a data only e-Sim for the USA but got there in the end. Once it was up and running it worked perfectly. It was good value for money and a lot cheaper than using a roaming package from my home mobile operator.

Review.Titre: First attempt at using an eSIM
Review.Contenu: Nomad made my first attempt at using an eSIM easy and straight forward mainly because of their App. It was also a lot less expensive than data roaming on my home country cell phone provider. I chose a multi-company eSIM for the UK to ensure I had good coverage from London to Scotland. It worked well except when I was moving (by train, bus or car) when it sometimes seemed to switch providers as I moved between towers causing Apps like Google Maps to freeze.

Review.Titre: eSIMs in Europe and UAE…
Review.Contenu: Both eSIMs in Europe and the United Arab Emirats worked absolutely great! Only, to keep the price per Gb reasonable, had to get bigger cards, respectively 20 and 10 Gb - ended up using only 5 and 2 Gb?! Please, work on getting down the price per Gb, so people can buy what they will effectively use. Thank you for caring!

Review.Titre: It was decent
Review.Contenu: It was decent. Worked really well in Singapore, Thailand, and Taiwan. Worked less well in Malaysia, and not very well in Vietnam. So I think it really depends on the country.

Review.Titre: The e-card worked perfectly in Paris
Review.Contenu: The e-card worked perfectly in Paris. Easy to install and nive connection. The only issue for me was that I recharge my e-card before my credits ended and I couldn't use this. When my first credit finished I had to buy another one to continuous using. I just recomend this :)

Review.Titre: Very useful for overseas vacation
Review.Contenu: Very useful for overseas vacation, but regret say that the signal was cut off for the last 21hrs.

Review.Titre: I was truly easy to use and set up
Review.Contenu: I was truly easy to use and set up, had a connection straight through my trip. Data speed seemed to be lower than what other people with sim cards got, but not significantly enough to go through the sleep to buy a sim card at every destination. I travel allot for work and this will be my new go-to supplier for cell connection.

Review.Titre: Was easy to install
Review.Contenu: Was easy to install and amazed how automatically added Works great in 3 countries i was in On the beginning the usage get too high without using that much but in the 3rd day was fine even in high use , thanks for the offers was very nice 👍🏽

Review.Titre: Great app for travellers on the go
Review.Contenu: Great app for travellers on the go. I managed with this e-Sim for Malaysia and Cambodia without switching to my primary provider whose charges are extremely high for Cambodia.I took out APAC package with 20GB at a reasonable price. Could have managed with just 5 GB for my duration of travel.Only annoying thing is the App does not warn you when you have nearly used up your quota. It just stop dead. And it is not easy to notice this is the status.Setting up could be tricky for those who are not savvy with your phone settings.Overall I am very happy to come across this travelling app.I will definitely use this service again.

Review.Titre: Easy to use, slight connection issues
Review.Contenu: Was very easy to pick a plan, install the eSIM and monitor data usage.During the travel I lost data connectivity for about a minute once or twice a day at random times. Other people in my group also used Nomad and didn't have this problem so maybe it was because my phone is several years old.

Review.Titre: Highly recommend Nomad e-Sim for your travels but need more flexible/cheaper options
Review.Contenu: Used Nomad e-Sim for 2week+ USA trip. Great to be able to use dual sim on my own phone - very flexible and easy. Online connectivity enabled me to navigate around cities easily, search for venues, hotels, sights, restaurants etc and stayed connected with friends and family all the time. Occasionally some web browsers would not load on service and had to wait for hotel WiFi to enable transaction.However, didn’t need 10GB for $20. Would like cheaper options for less GBs.

Review.Titre: Perfect except for one thing
Review.Contenu: Easy to install. Great prices. Worked perfectly. The only minus for me is that because of the Nomad esim, my phone thinks I’m in HK. I used esim for 2 week vacation, I saved tiktok vids for places to go to. I could not use my tiktok because it’s banned in HK.. So that was a bummer. Other than that, will be using Nomad for traveling abroad !

Review.Titre: Loved it!
Review.Contenu: Really great to be able to buy an e-sim and have cell service in England without having to change an actual SIM Card.  The only thing that would have made it a 5 star was to have the e-sim work immediately without having to actually take steps to activate it.  My mistake in thinking that when I switched on the e-sim, that it would work from that point onwards.  But that said, once I got past those first couple of steps, it worked like a charm.

Review.Titre: I’d like a bit more help with the instructions please!
Review.Contenu: I’ve used Nomad several times now, and it always seems to take me a while at the point of arriving in the country to get the activation settings correct. The instruction are good, but I would really like a better blow by blow series of screenshots. I’m on iOS and i never seem to get things right until, eventually I work it out - But I’ll keep using Nomad - it works great!

Review.Titre: Easy to use app & no need for a…
Review.Contenu: Easy to use app & no need for a physical sim. The only negative is I lost connection fairly frequently - which is an inconvenience when U're trying to find your way around a foreign city.

Review.Titre: Easy Purchase, Effortless Setup, and Outstanding Communication Quality
Review.Contenu: During my trip to Taiwan, my SIM card was damaged, and I needed a new SIM card as soon as possible. That's when I discovered this eSIM service.The eSIM plan was easy to compare and purchase. The activation code was sent to me immediately, allowing me to use my phone effortlessly.Being able to purchase and start using it within minutes without the need to visit a physical store was incredibly convenient. The network quality was excellent, and I would definitely use it again for my future trip.

Review.Titre: a decent expirence
Review.Contenu: Nomad was easy to setup and it worked like a charm. The only thing is (but this could be AT&T fault) that VoIP calls didn’t go through. When we were on wi-fi the same calls worked just fine. But on 4G it didn’t. We could watch videos, listen to music, even listen to the voice messages left on the same app.I got the package on a deal so it was well worth it!

Review.Titre: Value for money but occasional Network Issues
Review.Contenu: Value for money and relatively easy to install with instructions provided.The network however kept dropping off and coming on at certain areas. We are outdoors in a city and it was frustrating at times. We were using the Asia Regional plan for Tokyo.

Review.Titre: I installed the Nomad E-sim to provide…
Review.Contenu: I installed the Nomad E-sim to provide data for my iPhone & iPad whilst on holiday in the USA. I was able to use the iPhone hot-spot to connect my iPad. Everything worked well.The reason I am only giving 4 stars is because I had to buy a 1 month service when I was away for just 10 days, a cheaper 2 week option would be welcomed.

Review.Titre: Fair price for good service
Review.Contenu: Fair price for good service. Having often used traditional SIM cards for regular travels in Asia, the NOMAD esim is easy to use and fairly priced. Recently some connectivity hickups in Japan but switching 5G providers manually solved the problem. So could have been a provider issue and not NOMAD

Review.Titre: East Africa Safari
Review.Contenu: East Africa - Generally worked well. Only downside was that I had to keep turning e-SIM off and back on to reset the connection as I moved between towers. Aside from that I had great coverage throughout most of our 10-day safari. Would happily use again.

Review.Titre: Using Nomad ESIM for the first toime in the USA
Review.Contenu: The Nomad offering was really good for us as it would have cost us a lot of money otherwise. The buying and installing of this product was easy to do although actually getting it to work in the USA when we arrived took a little bit of amending settings which some of the details were on the Website and some I had to try and navigate. Once activated and in the USA all was working okay and we didnt get any data charges from my UK carrier. Would use again.

Review.Titre: Worked well
Review.Contenu: The app is easy to use and I had no issue during my two weeks in South Korea. Initially the connection was slow but after I turned off auto switching and selected a carrier from the list, it worked well. I selected SK.

Review.Titre: Perfect in 3/4 countries visited
Review.Contenu: I bought this on my iPhone (at home on wifi about an hour before travelling) and it took all of 90 seconds to buy and install, so that’s great. I went to the Netherlands, then Germany, then Italy, and finally France. I had awesome connections in all but Italy. In Italy, I downloaded a one-hour podcast on the podcast app in Italy, and it took about 70 minutes. Just for fun I did it in France and it was like, 10 seconds. So I was glad to only be in Italy for 3 of a 15-day trip. Except for there, it was absolutely top-notch. Would recommend for travel to the 3 non-Italy countries above.

Review.Titre: Worked well
Review.Contenu: Got the data plan in Europe as we were in several countries. Generally no issues, sometimes it was slower than others even in larger cities (only 2 bars), typically 4G coverage. The app is easy to use, no issues with set-up.

Review.Titre: Good plan, difficult to set up.
Review.Contenu: I found I used much less data than I thought. The price was good. The down side was that the e sim was difficult to set up. The instructions were not clear. I will use Nomad again.

Review.Titre: When it works....
Review.Contenu: When it works, it's great. But the first esim I got didn't work and it took 24 hours to really get customer service's attention. When you have their attention they are terrific; but I'm not sure their customer service software works well and it can be many hours before they respond to answers in a thread. Finally I got sorted.... but as a final joke the coupon code they gave me got rejected as expired. oh well.

Review.Titre: Worth the money
Review.Contenu: Overall the esim worked great, no issues with speed or connection. One thing tho, is that whenever I was looking at excursions to do in the area, the price was set to euros and if i looked at certain websites in the area, it would deny me access because I was outside of a certain region (I was in the states but my phone thought I was in London). Just a minor thing tho, overall it was awesome.

Review.Titre: Easy and friendly installation.
Review.Contenu: Easy and friendly installation.Coverage not always great.

Review.Titre: starting esim in USA
Review.Contenu: once i understood the installation was fairly straightforward but i thought that starting my new esim in the USA would be automatic, and it took a wifi and some fiddling to get it going.the visual explanation to change the settings was a little fast for me. You could maybe have a way to slow it down?

Review.Titre: Great Data Plan
Review.Contenu: This was awesome. I bought 10GB of data for my Europe trip, having seen that this is what I generally use in a month at home, and it was more than enough. The flexibility of using it in different countries seamlessly was great. What I didn't like, though, was the fact that it didn't give me a phone number that could send and receive sms messages which was a definite drawback, especially one I discovered that the European carriers have a flexible pay as you go plan that does let you do this. Still, this is a very affordable option for travel data.

Review.Titre: easy to purchase and install…
Review.Contenu: Pretty easy to purchase and install eSIM - admittedly I did have some trouble activating it ( since you have to be online to activate) and it took me 2-3 attempts to get going— but once activated everything was super reliable; sting connection and service in Japan. Price was fair

Review.Titre: The service was great everywhere in the…
Review.Contenu: The service was great everywhere in the 6 countries I travelled in Europe. The only thing I didn't like was I couldn't figure out how to see how much data I had used, so had no idea when it would run out...(and it did run out 4 days before my trip was done). Otherwise would definitely use again!

Review.Titre: Easy to use, spotty on train lines in the UK
Review.Contenu: The service was easy to get set up with an eSIM on my phone and connected right away. It must have preferred Swedish carriers because I would often get suggestions from Google in Swedish when I was connected.Had some trouble maintaining service on trainlines in the UK - service was spotty. I don't have a point of comparison with other providers, but I would be surprised if it is normal to have gaps in coverage along main train tracks. That's the reason for 4 starts out of 5. In cities the service worked very well, though, so you should have no trouble.

Review.Titre: Good but don't try and set it up before travelling
Review.Contenu: This is a cost effective and good way of getting data overseas that i have used a couple of times. The only problem is when you buy it before travelling (trying to be organised!), as then trying to activate it when overseas is highly confusing, problematic and takes time. If you just find some free wifi overseas then buy the nomad subscription, it works beautifully with a simple activation process throught the app.

Review.Titre: Quick to download, easy to use
Review.Contenu: Easy to buy and activate - I bought a data only simcard for China in half an hour before I left on the flight. The simcard was immediately online and I could resume using my phone as normal. I would note however, there was an outage one day and it was extremely difficult to contact for help to understand whether it was going to be a short period of time or something was wrong; I could not even submit a help request via the app. Network speeds were not fantastic though but usable for sure.

Review.Titre: Works great
Review.Contenu: Works great! Very easy to install and internet connection works everywhere. Nevertheless, I found that local suppliers offer better deals in terms of price, but I am not sure if they work well or not. Overall, very good experience with Nomad.

Review.Titre: Get the app
Review.Contenu: Once you understand the activation process and how everything works, it's very useful. Even better once you have the app. Advice: Download your sim card before going to a country because you'll be stuck at the airport trying to get on the wifi to complete the process.

Review.Titre: Nice app
Review.Contenu: Nice app ! EZ to use .Must set up contact transfer at home country, once at overseas u can’t activate bcos can’t transfer the contact , Ned to ask for refund .

Review.Titre: Esim no signal, never worked
Review.Contenu: Edit : They offered a full refund for the sim that was not working and I ordered another SIM (35 EU countries) which works fine.Thanks for helping me out.Original: I used to get airalo in the past. I read reviews about nomad and decided to give it a try.Purchased a Europe 20GB plan for 23€ but it never worked.First it got stuck at activating...I left it like this and after around an hour, it got activated itself but the esim is never able to connect to a network to get any signals.Waiting for several hours but it is still same. Tried all diagnostic mention in their app but still no luck.Also tried to contact support team but just received a generic reply, already sent them the settings screenshot but no reply thereafter.

Review.Titre: Excellent value for money & very good network coverage!
Review.Contenu: Excellent value for money, very good network coverage in the United States, even in considerable National Park territory and the purchase process was extremely easy. The only very minor negative, and the reason not getting there full 5 stars is that the setup procedure was a little fiddly and the instructions didn't match my mobile device. I fully appreciate down to the make of the phone, the model and indeed the operating system to name a few, but someone not as tech savvy as me would have definitely found it a struggle. Would have no hesitation purchasing for my next trip. Thank you!

Review.Titre: Reasonably priced and good overall experience
Review.Contenu: Nomad’s eSims were reasonably priced, easy to use and effective; I would use them again. We both got two eSims each for our time traveling in three countries (US, Turkey & Greece) for two weeks. For the most part, the eSims were reliable; however, we had three issues:1) Two of the four eSims wouldn’t let us use iMessage, but the third one did. We followed the instructions on the Nomad app to resolve it, but nothing worked.2) Otherwise, there were a few instances of performance issues (poor responsiveness), but those were resolved when I turned off my phone and turned it back on.3) No warning from Nomad that we were about to run out of data so we could buy more - which they acknowledge, but this needs to change. In our example, the only option was to pay our primary provider’s ridiculous roaming fees to get back online since we were driving and nowhere near wifi).None of the issues we had outweighed how much money we saved avoiding Bell’s outrageously expensive daily roaming fees - so as I said, I’d use them again.

Review.Titre: Needs data to activate on landing
Review.Contenu: I used this esim with my iPhone 13 when travelling to South East Asia. it works very well but setup was a little fiddly and the instructions were not 100% clear about some things: 1. The esims expire 30 days after purchase. Do not purchase it too early before your trip!2. You can only activate the esim when you are in the destination country.3. Your phone will need an active internet connection to activate the esim: so find a wifi hotspot at the airport, or turn on Mobile Data roaming on your existing mobile carrier (for one day)These details were not clear to me while purchasing, and I needed to search the internet for clarity. But once activated, the esim is good value and worked well as I moved between countries.

Review.Titre: All was good after I managed to…
Review.Contenu: All was good after I managed to activate the card. The UX is a bit confusing as there is an activation step upon adding the card to an IPhone 13 device, which left me with the impression that I am ready to go.After reaching my destination I had no mobile data.. I had to go back and figure that the actual activation is within the app. You might make that more visible in the communications send when purchasing the card. Hope that feedback helpsAll the best

Review.Titre: Easy to use service, really slow internet speeds
Review.Contenu: I was debating between a 2-star rating or a 3-star rating. The service is really easy to use and install, everything was flawlessly. (5 stars on this)The issue came with the most important thing for me and it is speed, with my recent visit to India it was a hit or miss, most of the times I had to be looking for WiFi since the internet speed was really really slow and was unusable. I purchased 15gb since my plan was always to not connect to WiFi however I ended up just using 4 out of the 15 since I always ended up using WiFiUpdate:Nomad customer service was really helpful on this matter. I still think the app was great speed was really bad however, great customer service always trying to look for ways to make customer happy!

Review.Titre: Connection is always great
Review.Contenu: Connection is always great, as we have been to Paris, London and NYC this year, we all used Nomad. However, the activation was not that simple. Especially you can only activate it when you arrived your destination and you will need to have wifi in order to activate it. Overall experience is excellent.

Review.Titre: Great alternative to daily travel…
Review.Contenu: Great alternative to daily travel plans! I used the Europe plan for 25 days. I traveled to 4 European countries in 12 days and the e-sim card worked great. I was able to get pretty good connection in France, Germany, and Greece. My only complaints are that my data didn't work in Switzerland at all and most of my home contacts were messed up while I traveled, and I still couldn't make international calls. Besides that, I had a good experience and will probably use this again.

Review.Titre: A first time user
Review.Contenu: A first time user, I found that the activation instructions were not very good and there were no videos available. I have an iPhone XR, had installed the eSIM but when I landed to destination had to do the process again and took me time to work out if the eSIM was correctly activated and that no data of my primary card was being used. Even so, I could during the whole trip not phone or receive phone calls. I guess something in the settings was not correct, but then again as mentioned the activation was not so straight forwards

Review.Titre: It is good tool you provide.
Review.Contenu: It is good tool you provide.2 feedback:-You use Singapore for main data providing. It makes me some problems. For example Nike customer support tied me Singapore.
